alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 15 at 2:39PM MST until February 16 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, additional snow accumulations of a dusting to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills are expected with values as low as 23 below zero. * WHERE...Far Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-25. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
